title: How to Connect the DS to the Wii for Animal Crossing

steps.headline: Get your DS ready.
steps.description: Power on your DS, and make sure that Animal Crossing: Wild World is inserted.

steps.headline: Start an Animal Crossing: City Folk game on your Wii.
steps.description: The DS Moving Van is only relevant at the start of Animal Crossing: City Folk. When starting a new game, choose “Move from DS!” instead of “Start fresh!”

steps.headline: Find and select the “Moving Van” option.
steps.description: From the DS main menu, select “DS Download Play.” On the next menu, choose “Moving Van.”

steps.headline: Register the character you'll be moving.
steps.description: Back on the Wii, Rover (the cat who assists you in starting the game) will prompt you to register the character that you've placed in the moving van on your DS. Select “Yep” to register and start the transfer. Note that only your character (name, face, and catalog) will be transferred. Bells and items in your pockets will not be transferred with your character.

steps.headline: Talk to Copper.
steps.description: In order to visit a friend's town on the DS, you will need to walk to your town gate and talk to Copper, the dog. Talk to him by pressing “A” and then choose the option “I wanna go out!”

steps.headline: Select DS Suitcase.
steps.description: Copper will ask if you want to do this via a Nintendo Wi-Fi connection or by DS suitcase; choose DS suitcase.

steps.headline: Turn on your DS.
steps.description: Do this by pressing the Power button located in the bottom right and tap on the “Download Play” panel from the DS menu (which boots up automatically upon turning the device on). If you haven't already, download the DS suitcase.

steps.headline: Put your DS in Sleep mode.
steps.description: Close the DS without turning it off so that it remains in Sleep mode.

steps.headline: Take your DS to your friend's Wii.
steps.description: In order to visit your friend's town, you will need to take your DS to their Wii. Turn on your friend's Wii with Animal Crossing: City Folk in the game tray.

steps.headline: Select DS Suitcase.
steps.description: When Rover appears to start the game, select “DS Suitcase” as opposed to proceeding as usual by choosing “Yeah!”

steps.headline: Connect to Wii.
steps.description: Open your DS back up and choose “Connect to the Wii” in order to transfer your data. Essentially, the DS has functioned as the middleman carrying your City Folk data from your Wii to your friend's Wii. Once this process is complete, you are free to turn the DS off. Now, you're free to roam around your friend's town! Be aware: you must return home the same way that you came (in this instance, the DS Suitcase). If you don't, you will lose all of the bells and items you had in your inventory before leaving.

methods.name: Returning Home from the DS Suitcase

steps.headline: Talk to Copper.
steps.description: Talk to Copper in your friend's village and choose “I wanna go out!”

steps.headline: Select DS Suitcase.
steps.description: Choose the option to go out via the DS Suitcase.

steps.headline: Select DS Suitcase from your DS menu.
steps.description: Turn on your DS, go to Download Play, and then tap on the “DS Suitcase.”

steps.headline: Put your DS in Sleep mode.
steps.description: Close your DS; it is important that you only close the DS and do not turn it off; if the device is powered down, it will not work.

steps.headline: Return to your Wii.
steps.description: Now you are free to leave your friend's house and return home to your Wii.

steps.headline: Run AC: City Folk.
steps.description: When you're back at your Wii, turn it on and run Animal Crossing: City Folk.

steps.headline: Talk to Rover.
steps.description: On the screen with Rover, choose the option “I'm back!”

steps.headline: Connect to Wii.
steps.description:
Then you will be prompted to send your character back into your town from the DS Suitcase by selecting “Connect to the Wii.”
Once this process is complete, you are once again safe to turn your DS off and will find yourself back home!

text:
Transferring a Character Get your DS ready. Power on your DS, and make sure that Animal Crossing: Wild World is inserted. Start an Animal Crossing: City Folk game on your Wii. The DS Moving Van is only relevant at the start of Animal Crossing: City Folk. When starting a new game, choose “Move from DS!” instead of “Start fresh!” Find and select the “Moving Van” option. From the DS main menu, select “DS Download Play.” On the next menu, choose “Moving Van.” Register the character you'll be moving. Back on the Wii, Rover (the cat who assists you in starting the game) will prompt you to register the character that you've placed in the moving van on your DS. Select “Yep” to register and start the transfer. Note that only your character (name, face, and catalog) will be transferred. Bells and items in your pockets will not be transferred with your character. Traveling with the DS Suitcase Talk to Copper. In order to visit a friend's town on the DS, you will need to walk to your town gate and talk to Copper, the dog. Talk to him by pressing “A” and then choose the option “I wanna go out!” Select DS Suitcase. Copper will ask if you want to do this via a Nintendo Wi-Fi connection or by DS suitcase; choose DS suitcase. Turn on your DS. Do this by pressing the Power button located in the bottom right and tap on the “Download Play” panel from the DS menu (which boots up automatically upon turning the device on). If you haven't already, download the DS suitcase. Put your DS in Sleep mode. Close the DS without turning it off so that it remains in Sleep mode. Take your DS to your friend's Wii. In order to visit your friend's town, you will need to take your DS to their Wii. Turn on your friend's Wii with Animal Crossing: City Folk in the game tray. Select DS Suitcase. When Rover appears to start the game, select “DS Suitcase” as opposed to proceeding as usual by choosing “Yeah!” Connect to Wii. Open your DS back up and choose “Connect to the Wii” in order to transfer your data. Essentially, the DS has functioned as the middleman carrying your City Folk data from your Wii to your friend's Wii. Once this process is complete, you are free to turn the DS off. Now, you're free to roam around your friend's town! Be aware: you must return home the same way that you came (in this instance, the DS Suitcase). If you don't, you will lose all of the bells and items you had in your inventory before leaving. Returning Home from the DS Suitcase Talk to Copper. Talk to Copper in your friend's village and choose “I wanna go out!” Select DS Suitcase. Choose the option to go out via the DS Suitcase. Select DS Suitcase from your DS menu. Turn on your DS, go to Download Play, and then tap on the “DS Suitcase.” Put your DS in Sleep mode. Close your DS; it is important that you only close the DS and do not turn it off; if the device is powered down, it will not work. Return to your Wii. Now you are free to leave your friend's house and return home to your Wii. Run AC: City Folk. When you're back at your Wii, turn it on and run Animal Crossing: City Folk. Talk to Rover. On the screen with Rover, choose the option “I'm back!” Connect to Wii. Then you will be prompted to send your character back into your town from the DS Suitcase by selecting “Connect to the Wii.”
Once this process is complete, you are once again safe to turn your DS off and will find yourself back home!
